alert.note: Alert for Haines Borough and Lynn Canal; Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island; Taiya Inlet and Klondike Highway (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued June 02 at 2:33PM AKDT until June 03 at 9:00PM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM AKDT FRIDAY FOR HIGH TEMPERATURES, LOW HUMIDITY, AND BREEZY CONDITIONS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 018, 019, AND 025... * AFFECTED AREA...Fire weather zones 018, 019, and 025. * WIND...May reach speeds up to 15 mph. * HUMIDITY...Relative humidity will fall into the low 20s or upper teens with temperatures from the mid 70s to mid 80s on Friday. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended. A warning means that severe fire weather conditions are already occurring or imminent in the warning area. Confidence is high that Red Flag conditions will return on Friday afternoon. As of Thursday afternoon, Red Flag conditions have already been recorded in all three fire zones. For Friday, temperatures will once again warm rapidly through the early afternoon and remain very warm into the evening hours. Additionally, breezy conditions will aid steep reductions in relative humidity which will enhance the spread of any uncontained fires should they develop. Please advise the appropriate officials and fire crews in the field of this red flag warning. This statement will be updated by 9 PM AKDT Friday or sooner if conditions warrant. &&

area.areaDesc: Haines Borough and Lynn Canal; Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island; Taiya Inlet and Klondike Highway
